edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikEncryptedZero

Class SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikEncryptedZero.SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaProverInput, ZKProverInput

    public class SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverInput
    Concrete implementation of SigmaProtocol input, used by the SigmaDamgardJurikEncryptedZeroProver. In SigmaProtocolDamgardJurikEncryptedZero, the prover gets DamgardJurikPublicKey, BigIntegerCiphertext and the random BigInteger used to encrypt.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput(DamgardJurikPublicKey publicKey, BigIntegerCiphertext cipher, DamgardJurikPrivateKey privateKey)
      This protocol assumes that the prover knows the randomness used to encrypt.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput

        public SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput(DamgardJurikPublicKey publicKey,
                               BigIntegerCiphertext cipher,

        Sets the given public key, ciphertext and random value used to encrypt.
        Parameters:

        r - random value used to encrypt.

      • SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput

        public SigmaDJEncryptedZeroProverInput(DamgardJurikPublicKey publicKey,
                               BigIntegerCiphertext cipher,
                               DamgardJurikPrivateKey privateKey)
        This protocol assumes that the prover knows the randomness used to encrypt. If the prover knows the secret key, then it can compute (once) the value m=n^(-1) mod phi(n)=n^(-1) mod (p-1)(q-1). Then, it can recover the randomness r from c by computing c^m mod n (this equals r^(n/n) mod n = r). Once given r, the prover can proceed with the protocol.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - used to encrypt.
        cipher - encryption on the given plaintext.
        privateKey - used for decrypt.
